intro: Illipe schlechteri, commonly known as the African illipe, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a broad, spreading crown. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, ovate leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody pods containing oily seeds.
